image.altText: A white man pours sand into the palm of an Aboriginal man.

props.synopsis: This photo was burned into Australia's memory, but the story behind the 50-year-old snap might shock you.

title.children: The untold history of one of Australia's most iconic photos

image.altText: A man with olive complexion, brown hair that rests on forehead, head resting on chin, sitting and looking to left.

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest has heard that a man who shot his ex-partner in the stomach before taking his own life had made attempts to seek help in the weeks prior to the tragedy.

title.children: Police missed 'red flags' prior to attempted murder-suicide, inquest hears

image.altText: A line of election candidate corflutes on a wide pavement, on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: As Northern Territorians head to the polls for local government elections today, academics and politicians say not enough is being done to encourage Aboriginal voter participation.

title.children: Low turnout among Aboriginal voters a concern ahead of NT local elections

image.altText: A crowd of people walking together along a red dirt road in the outback.

props.synopsis: Gough Whitlam poured sand into the hands of Vincent Lingiari 50 years ago, marking the first Aboriginal community to be given land back from the Commonwealth — but Gurindji leaders say more still needs to be done to ensure economic prosperity.

title.children: It's been half a century since land was returned to these traditional owners

image.altText: Two Aboriginal men on a dark lit stage with orchestra behind them. Left man playing didigeridoo, right playing clapsticks

props.synopsis: A Yolŋu songman has collaborated with the Darwin Symphony Orchestra to create a musical experience combining ancient songlines with a classical ensemble.

title.children: Ancient songlines from Arnhem Land meet a classical symphony on Darwin stage

image.altText: A Northern Territory Police car.

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have charged a 48-year-old man over the alleged fatal poisoning of his female partner in March last year.

title.children: Man charged 18 months after alleged fatal poisoning of female partner

image.altText: A man wearing a tie walking with a woman outside.

props.synopsis: Accusations of lies and collusion along with profanity-laden secret phone recordings have taken centre stage in the third week of the high-profile trial against Matt Wright.

title.children: 'Stick to the Matt Wright party line': Witnesses accused of lying in trial

image.altText: Jes Star and her daughter Eden outside their tiny home.

props.synopsis: A Facebook post offering women $55,000 to build their first home looked like a scam. But 15 women took the chance to go from homeless to home owner.

title.children: These women built their first homes for under $120k. Here’s how they did it

image.altText: A small coastal village, seen from the air, on a fine day.

props.synopsis: In some ways, this Welsh town is idyllic. But its 750 residents face an uncertain future and are even being branded the United Kingdom's first climate refugees.

title.children: Plans to surrender idyllic UK town to the sea

image.altText: A sign outside an Aldi store

props.synopsis: Unions and some retail workers are calling on major retailers to back down on mandatory bag checks and security gates.

title.children: Staff safety concerns raised over supermarket bag checks, security gates

image.altText: Pete Hegseth looks to the side while wearing a blue suit.

props.synopsis: The firing of the head of the US Defense Intelligency Agency (DIA) Lieutenant General Jeffery Kruse comes after the DIA produced a preliminary assessment that said US strikes on Iran set back Tehran's nuclear program by just a few months.

title.children: Hegseth fires intelligence boss after Trump angered by Iran strike damage report

image.altText: Toby Greene snaps through a goal among multiple Saints players

props.synopsis: The GWS Giants host St Kilda at the Sydney Showgrounds as one of four separate teams who require a win to seal their spot in the top eight for the AFL finals. Follow live.

title.children: Giants rocked by Saints barrage as star midfielder fails concussion test

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Coniglio subbed off after failing concussion test

image.altText: A man with thick grey-white moustache, wearing dark glasses, khaki bucket hat

props.synopsis: Garrison St Clair was touted as an all-American rescuer sent to the Australian desert to find a missing adventurer. But soon after he entered the spotlight, his grand backstory began to unravel.

title.children: Garrison St Clair went to find Robert Bogucki in the desert — then his lies came unstuck

image.altText: CARRA LUKE taigum

props.synopsis: Ms Luke, 48, was found with fatal stab wounds at her home in Taigum early Saturday morning.

title.children: Man charged with former partner Carra Luke's murder

image.altText: Chris Flinos

props.synopsis: A crypto CEO accused of fraud in Abu Dhabi is now working at a suburban mortgage broker in Melbourne.

title.children: The collapsed crypto boss now working at a Melbourne mortgage broker

image.altText: a teenage white girl stares into the camera for a mug shot photo

props.synopsis: Kristin Brock and James Brock were found dead in their home in the US state of Georgia in February. Their teenage daughter is now charged with their killings.

title.children: US teen who begged TikTok for help after parents' deaths charged with murder

image.altText: Minjee Lee swings a golf club

props.synopsis: Australia's Minjee Lee continues her strong form with a pair of eagles in the third round of the Canadian Women's Open to share the lead with hometown hero Brooke Henderson.

title.children: Double eagles help Lee draw level with hometown hero at Canadian Open

image.altText: several dogs sitting in back of a mini bus

props.synopsis: Sitting in their usual seats, the dogs' excitement is palpable as they head to a doggy daycare park where, amid the canine capers, they are changing the lives of people living with disability and loneliness.

title.children: Paws, play and TikTok fame, it's the happiest bus ride in Australia

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers won't be making big reforms to the tax system immediately. He knows major policy changes can have unintended consequences.

title.children: The 'golden era' of reform in the 1980s and 90s had a dark side

image.altText: The hand of woman wearing a grey long sleeve top rests on her patterned skirt

props.synopsis: One Far North Queensland sexual assault support service says it's helped 41 older women in the past three years.

title.children: Advocates call for focus on 'neglected' form of elder abuse

image.altText: A woman in a white and pink costume performs air guitar on a stage.

props.synopsis: Aapo "The Angus" Rautio's high-energy routine secures Finland's first air guitar title since 2000 in front of a hometown crowd in Oulu.

title.children: Air guitar world title returns to Finland after 25 years

image.altText: A middle-aged woman speaks behind a lectern in front of a deep blue background.

props.synopsis: The changes are being announced just days after the government was urged to take action by the Economic Reform Roundtable.

title.children: Government to freeze construction code, fast-track housing approvals

image.altText: Serena Williams and Maria Sharapova side by side

props.synopsis: Maria Sharapova and the crowd are left stunned as her fiercest rival Serena Williams makes an appearance at her induction into the International Tennis Hall of Fame.

title.children: Williams praises Sharapova's 'excellence' in surprise hall of fame appearance

image.altText: Tom Gleeson standing with his arms crossed with a serious look on his face with th Hard quiz logo in the top left corner

props.synopsis: I see you're ready to be taken down a peg or two. I can sort that out.

title.children: So you think you're a Smarty Pants? Let's play … HARD!

image.altText: Joseph Suaalii attempts to lay a tackle on Jesse Kriel

props.synopsis: The Wallabies give South Africa all they can handle in Cape Town, but fail to record consecutive wins over the Springboks.

title.children: 'Could've gone either way': Injury-hit Wallabies fall short of second-straight South Africa heist

image.altText: A close up photo of a phone with dating apps like Tinder, Grindr and Bumble on the screen.

props.synopsis: Online dating offers a bigger pool of potential partners, but a new study shows it can lead to less passionate, satisfying and intimate relationships.

title.children: Online dating may not be the best way to meet a partner, study shows

image.altText: The silhouette of a person wearing a brim hat, against a bright and partly cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: LGBTQIA+ advocates are urging Vanuatu's government to dump an amendment to the constitution that would recognise only the rights of "individuals who are male or female at birth".

title.children: Supporters say Vanuatu's controversial 'two sexes law' aligns with the Bible

image.altText: A small marsupial on the ground at night

props.synopsis: Three endangered northern bettongs that were raised in captivity have made a successful entry into the wild at a north Queensland sanctuary.

title.children: Endangered northern bettongs take first walk on the wild side

image.altText: Two trains pass abandoned Woollahra station

props.synopsis: The partly-built Woollahra Station is set to be finished and nearby land rezoned for housing under a plan to "rebalance" the development of new housing in Sydney

title.children: Sydney's east to get revamped train station, thousands of new homes

image.altText: Anthony Radford two (also good for generic)

props.synopsis: Community members and local authors are concerned Bendigo's reputation has been damaged following this year's Bendigo Writers Festival controversy, which resulted in more than 50 writers and hosts withdrawing.

title.children: Regional city fears reputational hit over writers' festival fallout

image.altText: Three men in nightgowns, laughing in the forest.

props.synopsis: Sketch group Aunty Donna have spent more than a decade working tirelessly for a seat at Australia’s comedy table. Now they’re pulling chairs up for new creators.

title.children: How Aunty Donna bypassed the gatekeepers to rule Australian comedy

image.altText: Two men looking into each others eyes as they hug each other.

props.synopsis: The Anschau family started sponsoring Edward Kankaka in 1995, exchanging letters and photos. Three decades on, they finally meet the man with the "huge smile" in person.

title.children: Australian family meets Ugandan child sponsor after three decades

image.altText: A teenage boy playing drums on stage with a band.

props.synopsis: Young musicians in NSW are staging an all-ages live music event to create more opportunities for emerging artists and lift the festival industry.

title.children: Young musicians go behind the scenes to drive next wave of festivals
